name: Holiday Inn Express Clearwater North/Dunedin

reviews.text: Nice rooms. Small pool. Right out the back door is Pinellas bike trail. Lovely area 2-3 blocks from bars , restaurants, shopping. Good breakfast. We stayed during spring break week do rooms were a little $$$. Location excellent. Many baseball fans here for spring training. Several said they walked to stadium. Enjoy!
reviews.title: Fantastic location. Walking distance to restaurants, ballpark, bike trail.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Typical Holiday Inn Express, but no microwave. Quiet, comfortable, clean - no complaints.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location when in Dunedin Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place. Staff & accomadations were A+.
reviews.title: Extremely Comfortable...

reviews.text: I must say that the "Holiday Inn" chain is coming ou w/ some very good hotels.
reviews.title: I love this place!

reviews.text: This is my second stay at this hotel in the last three months. It is very, very clean. When you walk in the lobby you get the feeling you just came home and the maids have been there all day. (Not that I have maids.) It's cheerful, well lit and has an updated, new feel to it. They have a small pool and exercise room. The front desk people are fabulous. I went to leave and it was pouring rain so they lent me an umbrella. Also they have a great little free breakfast. It's just a block from a little harbor and the water. And if you like small, adorable shops and a town with a quaint feeling to it....this is it. I use to live in Dunedin and I still love it here. Want the beach? It's not that far away with maybe a 20 minute drive depending on traffic. So all in all I really enjoyed my stay and will come back again when I have to visit family here again. And I think this is the first review I've written that doesn't have a bunch of typos. I do know how to type..LOL!
reviews.title: Basic but Very Good

reviews.text: Spent three nights at this Holiday Inn Express using reward points. Firstly the hotel is in a great location surrounded by restaurants and bars - fantastic compared to our previous 10 days in Orlando which required a car to go anywhere. The room was clean and a decent size with all usual mod cons. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the complimentary breakfast was much better than i thought it would be. I would definitely recommend this hotel if staying in the area.
reviews.title: Good hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff very accomadating!! We even locked our keys in the rental car with it running! Staff called someone to come unlock car. manager checked to see if there was anything he could do to relieve our stress while we waited. Complementary breakfast buffet was delicious! Great selection! Very convenient location... easy to get to Tarpon Springs, Clearwater,etc. Marina, restaurants, trail, and great little ice cream place all within walking distance!
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.text: Has been the perfect place for us to stay the night before we check into our rental on Clearwater Beach. This was actually our 2nd stay and we plan on making next year our 3rd. Pool is great for the kids and the breakfast is great too!! Rooms are clean as is rest of hotel.
reviews.title: Repeat stays will continue

reviews.text: We rented 2 rooms for a family visit in Dunedin. Hotel was accommodating and friendly, location is excellent - right on the walking trail. Easy walk to shopping and restaurants and very close to the Dunedin Brewery and Jenson Bros. Seafood where you can buy much fresh fish - we bought some stone crab claws for the beach. Easy drive to Honeymoon Island which has a beautiful beach. Good complimentary breakfast buffet at the hotel, bacon, eggs, sausage, biscuits, toast, juice, coffee and a nice DIY pancake machine.
reviews.title: Good location, nice hotel in Dunedin

reviews.text: This was overall a nice HI Express. The location is very good if you are visiting the Dunedin shops, breweries, restaurants and beaches. Maybe a bit on the pricey side but it had a better than average breakfast. Room pretty typical for a new-ish HI Express. Staff seemed helpful and friendly, although I did not have any issues to deal with during my stay so I didn't ask much of them. Walk across the street and try a Berliner Weisse at the 7venth Sun Brewery. You will thank me.
reviews.title: Very good location in Dunedin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Almost didn't stay here due to the dated looking pictures. Don't let the pics fool you. The rooms have been updated compared to the pics I saw on their website. The lady at the front desk, Grace, was very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and clean. Enjoyed the hot tub and the pool was clean. Being able to walk to the restaurants was a huge bonus. So many options to walk to downtown. Had a great time!
reviews.title: Loved our time here!

reviews.text: Stayed there for a couple of nights before Christmas, booked the room with priority club points, was given a nice room in the back of the hotel, not inferior to any other standard room. The rooms are clean and comfortable, space is adequate. Hotel is quiet, even when a close-by outdoors bar two doors down the trail that passes behind the hotel is in full swing. Staff of the hotel are extra courteous and accommodating. All standard amenities are there. The breakfast is also similar to what is found in most places, nothing extraordinary but nothing missing as well. Main street of small town is two blocks away and accessible from aforementioned trail. Overall a great stay just a block from the water and would definitely recommend it for no hassle, problem free, quiet relaxing vacation.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay, priority club point friendly
In the middle of a walkable "small town"
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights at the start of a trip. A great way to start! Super clean rooms and public areas. Good value buffet breakfast and as other reviewers have said very nice staff. Easy 5 minute walk to all the downtown restaurants and shops and direct access to the Pinellas Trail cycleway. A great bike rental place is just across the trail from the hotel, "Dunedin Cyclery", very helpful staff there as well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: HIE; typical: clean, new, good breakfast, good location, friendly staff: zero complaints, would return in a heartbeat
reviews.title: great property for the money

reviews.text: Perfect place to stay at a reasonable price. The room was clean, the breakfast good (variety of choices: bagels/breads, yogurts, bananas, cereal, egg omelets, juices & hot drinks), the lobby & hang out area was comfortable. There's a pool & hot tub too. Best part was it is right next to the walk/bikeway that goes into town, so we were able to stroll down & check out the shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When in Dunedin we always stay at this Holiday Inn Express. The property is well maintained and has great management. We especially like to stay there because of its close proximity to downtown Dunedin. A short walk takes you to many good restaurants, shops and the Gulf to watch the great sunsets. You can also rent a bike in town if you choose to bike the Pinella Trail which is directly behind the hotel. Many thanks to Peter Mullens who took the extra time to move us to a king room during our stay.
reviews.title: Super Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 3 night stay over a weekend was not cheap, but this is a very good HIE. We were in town to watch Blue Jays Spring Training, and the ballpark is an easy pedestrianised walk away. Bars and restaurants are 2 blocks away.
reviews.title: High quality in an ideal location

reviews.text: The hotel is modern, quiet and very comfortable. Breakfast was very good. Good guest laundry - cheap, with 2 machines and driers, which happened to be important to us at this stage of the trip
reviews.title: Holiday Inn Express Dunedin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with three friends in early April 2012. Overall, it was a great trip and I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The hotel was very clean and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great folks and clean room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was fully booked (it was during spring break) and most of the other guests seemed to be families with children, but we didn't encounter any problems with noise, etc. My only (very minor) complaint is that the breakfast area was very crowded each morning and we had to hang around and wait for some seats to open up; I wish there were more tables outside by the pool so we could have brought our breakfast outside instead of "hovering" and waiting for other guests to finish eating. But the hotel staff did open a conference room up for extra seating so in the end it wasn't really a major issue. The breakfast selection was good, but I think the juice machine needed a tune-up (the juice was very watery)! I brought my own oatmeal and the staff was kind enough to let me use the microwave in their kitchen.
reviews.title: Spent a week here and loved it!

aka: Holiday Inn Express Clearwater North/Dunedin Hotel
description: The Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Clearwater North / Dunedin is located on the West Coast of Florida, just north of Clearwater! We welcome our guests to quaint & delightful downtown Dunedin. The Holiday Inn Express Hotel is within walking distance of the downtown's shopping district with antique and specialty shops galore, award-winning restaurants, and the Toronto Blue Jays' spring training at Knology Park. For the outdoor enthusiast, there is bicycling, walking, and rollerblading on the renowned Pinellas Trail just outside our back door. Nature trails, golf, windsurfing, jet skiing, fishing and sailing are just minutes from the property as are the award-winning beaches of Honeymoon and Caladesi Island State Parks. Dunedin hosts numerous year-round cultural events and festivals, such as: Mardi Gras, Art Harvest, Island Fest and the Highland Games. Our hotel features: 76 guest rooms and suites, including Kid suites, outdoor heated pool/whirlpool, fitness center, and all the amenities that Holiday Inn Express is known for. Visit Dunedin, FL and stay smart at the Holiday Inn Express Hotel.
